title: gprofiler
code: # see more <https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/sparklines-bar-customisation/> bar_formatter <- function(values,palette = "viridis") {   cols <- scales::col_numeric(palette, domain = NULL)(values)   names(cols) <- scales::number_format(accuracy = 0.001)(values)   cols_dict = jsonlite::toJSON(as.list(cols),auto_unbox = T)    formatter_code <- htmlwidgets::JS(sprintf('function formatter(params) {   const cols_dict = %s;   const { yValue } = params;   const col = cols_dict[yValue.toFixed(3)];   return {fill: col} }',cols_dict))   formatter_code } table <- table |>    ag_col_render("−log10(pval)",     cellRenderer = "agSparklineCellRenderer",     cellRendererParams = list(       sparklineOptions = list(         type = "bar",         valueAxisDomain = range(go_mf$`−log10(pval)`),         formatter = bar_formatter(go_mf$`−log10(pval)`)       )     ),     minWidth = 200   ) #> Warning: By default htmlwidgets set auto_unbox = TRUE so the 1 length atomic elements #> are not send as array. So default set `valueGetter` to convert Number to Array.

${params.value}
${params.column.colId}
`; } getGui() { return this.eGui; } } )") table |> ag_col_def(columns = starts_with("ENSG") , # headerClass = "rotated-header", sortable = F, menuTabs = F, suppressSpanHeaderHeight = F, headerClass = "customHeaderLabel", width = 20, cellClass = 'no-padding', cellRenderer = get_gene_color_code(go_mf), tooltipValueGetter = JS('(params) => { return params.value;}'), tooltipComponent = tooltipComponent ) |> # set aggrid options ag_gridOptions(headerHeight = 32,groupHeaderHeight = 95, getContextMenuItems = JS('() => []'), tooltipShowDelay = 0) |> ag_size_columns(skipHeader = T) #> Warning in RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n, pal): n too large, allowed maximum for palette Set1 is 9 #> Returning the palette you asked for with that many colors

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: create aggrid table, use aggrid() data frame matrix.
code: library(aggrid) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(htmlwidgets)  aggrid(iris)

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: column width adjustment, can use ag_col_def() ag_col_width().
code: aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_def(columns = c(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width), width = 80) aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_width(c(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width), width = 80)

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: don’t want particular column included auto resize, can use size_to_fit(). example, want first column remain fixed width, columns fill width table.
code: iris |>   dplyr::relocate(Species) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_width(Species, width = 400) |>   ag_size_fit()

text: Auto width fit contents cells column. options please see https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/column-properties.
code: aggrid(iris) |>   ag_size_columns()

code: aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_filter(Sepal.Length, filter = FALSE) |>   ag_col_filter(Species, filter = "agTextColumnFilter")

code: aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_pinned(Species, pinned = "left")

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: default, aggrid() remove colnames dots, use ag_col_header() can custom colnames. code bad, can use ag_col_defs() vectorization. menuTabs parameter default c('filterMenuTab','generalMenuTab','columnsMenuTab'), want filter menuTab, can:
code: aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_header(Sepal.Length, headerName = c("Sepal.Length")) |>   ag_col_header(Sepal.Width, headerName = c("Sepal.Width")) aggrid(iris) |>   ag_col_defs(columns = everything(), headerName = names(iris)) head(iris, n = 10) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_def(columns = Species, menuTabs = list("filterMenuTab"))

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: Center header: Set content content center:
code: head(iris, n = 10) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_group(columns = starts_with("Sepal"), headerName = "Sepal") head(iris, n = 10) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_group(columns = starts_with("Sepal"), headerName = "Sepal", headerClass = "ag-header-center") |>   ag_col_group(columns = starts_with("Petal"), headerName = "Petal", headerClass = "ag-header-center") head(iris, n = 10) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_group(columns = starts_with("Sepal"), headerName = "Sepal", headerClass = "ag-header-center") |>   ag_col_group(columns = starts_with("Petal"), headerName = "Petal", headerClass = "ag-header-center") |>   ag_col_def(cellStyle = list(textAlign = "center"), headerClass = "ag-header-center")

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: ag_col_format() use numeraljs format number. Custom columns format use valueFormatter:
code: data.frame(   price = c(9603.01, 100, 98322),   percent = c(0.9525556, 0.5, 0.112),   exponential = c(123456789, 0.0001314, 0.52),   bytes = c(1024^3, 1024^2, 1024) ) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_format(price, "$0,0.000") |>   ag_col_format(percent, "0.0%") |>   ag_col_format(exponential, "0,0e+0") |>   ag_col_format(bytes, "0 b") data.frame(   Area = c(1000, 200, 40) ) |>   aggrid() |>   ag_col_def(valueFormatter = JS('     (params) => {return params.value + " mi\u00b2";};   '))

title: Examples 1: Coulmns Properties
text: valueFormatter mainly used formatting, cellRenderer use adding html tags cellStyle use cell style. : need encapsulate simple functions modify cellRender. example see <./Examples2.html>
code: data.frame( go_term = c("GO:0140359", "GO:0036094", "GO:0048029", "GO:0042626", "GO:0097367"), p_value = c(3.30e-07, 1.60473e-06, 2.47191e-01, 1.19e-05, 0.05) ) |> aggrid() |> ag_col_render(go_term, cellRenderer = JS('(params) => { return `${params.value}` };')) |> ag_col_render(p_value, cellStyle = JS('function(params) { if (params.value <= 0.05) { return { color: "green" }; } else{ return { color: "red" }; } }'))

title: Intro
text: big data, e.g. millions rows,use server model. Although code can used render within 5~6s, operations sorting become slowly.server model work shiny.
code: purrr::map_dfr(seq_len(10000), ~iris) |>      aggrid() library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   aggridOutput("test") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$test <- renderAggrid({     purrr::map_dfr(seq_len(10000), ~iris) |>        aggrid(server = T)   })   observe({     print(input$test_rows_selected)   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Column Definitions — ag_col_def
text: x aggrid Object columns Specify column modify, Default columns. field field row object get cell's data .  Deep references row object supported via dot notation, .e 'address.firstLine'. colId unique ID give column. optional. missing, ID default field.   field colId missing, unique ID generated.   ID used identify column API sorting, filtering etc. type comma separated string array strings containing ColumnType keys can used template column.  helps reduce duplication properties lot common column properties. cellDataType data type cell values column.  Can either infer data type row data (true - default behaviour),  define specific data type (string), data type (false).    setting specific data type (string value),  can either one pre-defined data types  'text', 'number',  'boolean',  'date',  'dateString'  'object',  custom data type defined dataTypeDefinitions grid option.     Data type inference works Client-Side Row Model, requires non-null data.  also work valueGetter, valueParser refData properties defined,  column sparkline. valueGetter Function expression. Gets value data display. valueFormatter function expression format value, return string. used CSV export copy clipboard, UI cell rendering. refData Provided reference data map used map column values respective value map. keyCreator Function return string key value.  string used grouping, Set filtering, searching within cell editor dropdowns.  filtering searching string exposed user, make sure return human-readable value. equals Custom comparator values, used renderer know values changed. Cells whose values changed get refreshed.  default grid uses === work use cases. checkboxSelection Set true (return true function) render selection checkbox column. showDisabledCheckboxes Set true display disabled checkbox row selectable checkboxes enabled. toolPanelClass CSS class use tool panel cell. Can string, array strings, function. suppressColumnsToolPanel Set true want column group appear Columns Tool Panel. columnGroupShow Whether show column group open / closed. set column always displayed part group. icons Icons use inside column instead grid's default icons. Leave undefined use defaults. suppressNavigable Set true column navigable (.e. tabbed ), otherwise false.  Can also callback function different rows navigable. suppressKeyboardEvent Allows user suppress certain keyboard events grid cell. suppressPaste Pasting default long cells editable (non-editable cells modified, even paste operation).  Set true turn paste operations . suppressFillHandle Set true prevent fillHandle rendered cell belongs column. ... please see https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/column-properties/.

Default false autoHeaderHeight enabled column header row automatically adjust height accommodate size header cell.  can useful using headerComponent long header names conjunction wrapHeaderText. menuTabs Set array containing zero, one many following options: 'filterMenuTab' | 'generalMenuTab' | 'columnsMenuTab'.  used figure menu tabs present order tabs shown. columnsMenuParams Params used change behaviour appearance Columns Menu tab. details suppressMenu Set true menu shown column header. suppressHeaderKeyboardEvent Suppress grid taking action relevant keyboard event header focused. details headerCheckboxSelection true callback returns true, 'select ' checkbox put header. details headerCheckboxSelectionFilteredOnly true, header checkbox selection select filtered items. headerCheckboxSelectionCurrentPageOnly true, header checkbox selection select nodes current page. ... please see https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/column-properties/.

title: Custom colums width — ag_col_width
text: x aggrid Object columns Specify column modify, Default columns. width Initial width pixels cell. initialWidth width, except applied creating new column. applied updating column definitions. minWidth Minimum width pixels cell. maxWidth Maximum width pixels cell. flex Used instead width goal fill remaining empty space grid. initialFlex flex, except applied creating new column. applied updating column definitions. resizable Set true allow column resized. suppressSizeToFit Set true want column's width fixed 'size fit' operations. suppressAutoSize Set true want column auto-resizable double clicking edge. ... please see https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/column-properties/.

title: Create a HTML widget using the ag-grid library — aggrid
text: data data frame matrix. rowSelection three options：multiple,single. suppressRowClickSelection TRUE, disable row selection clicking. selectedRows set default selectedRows rows. checkboxSelection Enable checkbox first column? pagination Enable pagination allows? paginationPageSize default size 10. ... options, please see https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-options theme Specify theme. Default ag-theme-balham. please see https://www.ag-grid.com/example/?theme=ag-theme-alpine community Enable use community? use_cdn Depends resource use cdn? server server model width, height Width/Height pixels (optional, defaults automatic sizing) elementId id widget (random string default).

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: page lists tidy eval tools reexported package rlang. learn using tidy eval scripts packages high level, see dplyr programming vignette ggplot2 packages vignette. Metaprogramming section Advanced R may also useful deeper dive. tidy eval operators {{, !!, !!! syntactic constructs specially interpreted tidy eval functions. mostly need {{, !! !!! advanced operators use simple cases. curly-curly operator {{ allows tunnel data-variables passed function arguments inside tidy eval functions. {{ designed individual arguments. pass multiple arguments contained dots, use ... normal way.   enquo() enquos() delay execution one several function arguments. former returns single expression, latter returns list expressions. defused, expressions longer evaluate . must injected back evaluation context !! (single expression) !!! (list expressions).   simple case, code equivalent usage {{ ... . Defusing enquo() enquos() needed complex cases, instance need inspect modify expressions way. .data pronoun object represents current slice data. variable name string, use .data pronoun subset variable [[.   Another tidy eval operator :=. makes possible use glue curly-curly syntax LHS =. technical reasons, R language support complex expressions left =, use := workaround.   Many tidy eval functions like dplyr::mutate() dplyr::summarise() give automatic name unnamed inputs. need create sort automatic names , use as_label(). instance, glue-tunnelling syntax can reproduced manually :   Expressions defused enquo() (tunnelled {{) need simple column names, can arbitrarily complex. as_label() handles cases gracefully. code assumes simple column name, use as_name() instead. safer throws error input name expected.
code: my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   data %>%     group_by(...) %>%     summarise(mean = mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, ...) {   # Defuse   var <- enquo(var)   dots <- enquos(...)    # Inject   data %>%     group_by(!!!dots) %>%     summarise(mean = mean(!!var)) } my_var <- "disp" mtcars %>% summarise(mean = mean(.data[[my_var]])) my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   # Use `{{` to tunnel function arguments and the usual glue   # operator `{` to interpolate plain strings.   data %>%     summarise("{{ var }}_mean_{suffix}" := mean({{ var }})) } my_function <- function(data, var, suffix = "foo") {   var <- enquo(var)   prefix <- as_label(var)   data %>%     summarise("{prefix}_mean_{suffix}" := mean(!!var)) }
